200.description: OK. If the report yields an empty data set, the response yields an empty set of rows.

columns.description: Indicates the consumption time of the content.
columns.name: Time

columns.description: Total number of requests made to the entry point posting objects.

schema.description: A data store is a collection of dimensions and metrics stored in a data base.

aggregation.description: Number of seconds for which data is aggregated.

dimensions.description: Encapsulates dimensions for the data store. A dimension acts like a key in data exploration and answers questions such as who, what, where, and which. Each dimension object provides information on the ID, name, type, and description of the dimension.

id.description: A unique identifier for each dimension.

type.description: The type of dimension, either `standard` or `custom`.

id.description: Unique identifier for each data store.

maxQueryDurationInMinutes.description: Maximum number of minutes for which a user can query a data store. It is a system-imposed limit for better performance.

metrics.description: Encapsulates metrics for the data store. A metric is a numeric aggregation against one or more dimensions and answers questions on volume of activity or attack. Each metric object provides information on the name, description, and ID of the metric.

id.description: A unique identifier for each metric.

name.description: The name of the data store.

purgeIntervalInDays.description: Number of days for which the data store keeps data.

type.description: The type of data store, either `standard` or `custom`.

parameters.description: Use to limit report data to specific CP codes. Comma-separate multiple values.
parameters.name: cpcodes

parameters.description: Identifies dimensions with comma-separated IDs.
parameters.name: dimensions

parameters.description: Identifies metrics with comma-separated IDs.
parameters.name: metrics

parameters.description: Specifies the end of the reported time range, expressed in `mm/dd/yyyy:HH:MM` format. The trailing `:HH:MM` 24-hour time segment is optional.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: Specifies the start of the reported time range, expressed in `mm/dd/yyyy:HH:MM` format. The trailing `:HH:MM` 24-hour time segment is optional.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The offset of the row for the start of data. Use this to request progressive batches of data. For example, you can make `10` requests for  `1000` records by setting the overall `limit` to `100`, then setting the `offset` to `0`, `100`, `200`, and so on for each request.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: The number of rows to return from `1` to `10000`. The default value is `300`.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: A UTF-8, URL-encoded JSON object representing filter parameters that limit reported data. See the [FilterParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-services-rpts/reference/filter-params) object for details on its structure.
parameters.name: filterParams

parameters.description: A UTF-8, URL-encoded JSON object representing sort parameters that rearrange reported data. See the [SortParams](https://techdocs.akamai.com/media-services-rpts/reference/sort-params) object for details on its structure.
parameters.name: sortParams

parameters.description: Identifies a set of reported streams as comma-separated ID values.
parameters.name: streams

parameters.description: The time period in which to group each data record, expressed as number of seconds.
parameters.name: aggregation

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

metaData.description: Reflects the set of parameter values included in the request that determines this report's results.

aggregation.description: The time span included in each record, expressed in seconds.

endTimeInEpoch.description: The end of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

hasMoreData.description: Indicates that a constrained set of requested data does not represent the entire set.

limit.description: The maximum number of requested data `rows`.

offset.description: The offset of the row from which the data should start. Used with overall `limit`, it reflects where a batch of data starts. For example, setting both `offset` and `limit` to `100` selects rows 101-200 from the overall results.

startTimeInEpoch.description: The start of the requested time range, in epoch seconds.

timeZone.description: Identifies the time zone from which the request was made.
